foodapp.title: Blackberry Ginger Iced Tea
foodapp.ingredients:
4 green tea bags, 
4 cups hot water,
2cups blackberries,
¾ cup pineapple,
½ lime,
1Tbsp ginger,
1 Tbsp maple syrup, 
¼ cup mint leaves,
½ lime, ice cubes
foodapp.preparation:
Add the green tea to the hot water and let it steep until it cools down completely. To a blender, add the blackberries, frozen pineapple, lime, ginger, and maple syrup. Blend until smooth. Strain the blended blackberry mixture through a sieve. Divide the puréed blackberry mixture between the glasses, followed by mint, lime slice cubes, and finish with the cooled green tea.
Stir and add more sweetener to taste. Garnish and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Mango Turmeric Lassi
foodapp.ingredients:
2 soft Medjool dates, 
2½cups mango, 
2 cups yogurt, 
¾ cup milk,
½ Tbsp ginger,
½ tsp turmeric,
1 pinch of black pepper,
¼ lemon
foodapp.preparation:
Add all the ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Brown Sugar Matcha Bubble Tea
foodapp.ingredients:
2 Tbsp brown sugar,
2 Tbsp boiling water,
½ cup tapioca pearls,
2 tsp matcha powder,
½ cup hot water, 
1 tsp pure vanilla extract
1cup ice cubes
2½ cups milk
foodapp.preparation:
Add the brown sugar and boiling water to a bowl. Stir until the sugar has dissolved.
In a saucepan, cook the tapioca pearls for 5 minutes.
Drain the tapioca pearls, rinse under cold water, and transfer to the brown sugar syrup jar. Give it a mix.
Sift the matcha powder into a bowl. Add the hot water. Whisk until there’s a foam layer on top of the matcha.
Add the vanilla extract to the matcha mixture and whisk again until combined.
Divide the brown sugar pearls between the glasses, top with the ice cubes, milk, and the matcha. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: High Protein Pancakes
foodapp.ingredients:
300g tofu,
1½cups milk, 
2Tbsp maple syrup,
2tsp vanilla extract,
2tsp lemon juice,
3½cups flour, 
2tsp baking powder,
1tsp baking soda,
1tsp cinnamon,
¼tsp salt,
1Tbsp vegetable oil,
1cup yogurt,
1cup mixed fresh berries
foodapp.preparation:
To a blender, add the tofu, pea milk, maple syrup, vanilla, and lemon juice. Blend until smooth.
To a large bowl, add the spelt flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Mix well. Add the wet ingredients from the blender. Mix until just combined, but be careful not to over-mix. If the mixture is too thick, add a splash of plant milk to thin it out a touch.
Heat a non-stick crêpe pan on medium-high heat and use a bit of oil to lightly grease the pan. Use a ¼ measuring cup to pour the batter onto the pan. Cook for 2 minutes on each side, or until golden. Continue with the leftover batter.
Top with yogurt, nuts, berries, and maple syrup, and enjoy.

foodapp.title: Oatmeal with Caramelized Pear
foodapp.ingredients:
1cup oats 
2cups milk 
1tsp cinnamon,
½tsp ginger,
¼tsp cloves,
⅛tsp allspice,
2Tbsp flaxseeds,
2tsp maple syrup,
1tsp blackstrap molasses,
1 pear, 
2tsp maple syrup
foodapp.preparation:
To a saucepan, add the oats, milk, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and allspice. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce to a simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
To a medium pan on medium-high heat, add the sliced pear and the maple syrup. Let the pear caramelize for about 4 minutes while stirring and flipping the pear slices occasionally. Take off the heat.
To the saucepan of oatmeal, add the flaxseeds, maple syrup, and molasses and let it cook for another 1 - 2 minutes. Add more milk if you prefer a thinner consistency.
Divide the oatmeal, caramelized pear, yogurt, and pecans between the bowls. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Raspberry Lemonade Smoothie Bowl
foodapp.ingredients:
1½cups raspberries,
1 banana,
1 lemon, 
½cup yogurt,
½cup cashews,
¼cup milk,
1Tbsp agave syrup,
fresh fruit,
hemp seeds,
lemon zest,
vegan granola
foodapp.preparation:
Add all ingredients to a high-speed blender and blend until smooth.
Taste test. The raspberries are tart and the lemon is sour. If you feel it's needed, add more syrup to cut through the tartness.
Divide into bowls and add desired toppings. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Breakfast Waffles
foodapp.ingredients:
1½cups milk,
1Tbsp apple cider vinegar,
2cups flour,
⅓cup applesauce,
2tsp baking powder,
1tsp cinnamon,
1tsp vanilla extract,
½tsp salt
foodapp.preparation:
To a large bowl, add the milk and vinegar, mix, and let this rest for 5 minutes. Milk will start to slightly curdle.
Heat the waffle maker. Returning to the bowl, add the flour, applesauce, baking powder, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt, then mix until just combined.
Brush the waffle pan with some oil. Add a few spoonfuls of the waffle batter until the element is filled near to the top. Gently close the lid, and let it cook for 4-5 minutes, or until golden. Repeat this with the remaining batter.
Add toppings to your waffles, and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Crunchy Almond & Mango Granola
foodapp.ingredients:
2½cups oats,
1cup quinoa, 
½cup almonds,
½cup shredded coconut,
½cup pumpkin seeds, 
¼cup sugar,
½tsp cinnamon,
¼cup vegetable oil,
¼cup maple syrup,
¼cup almond butter,
1tsp vanilla extract,
¾tsp salt,
2Tbsp hemp seeds,
½cup dried mango
foodapp.preparation:
Preheat the oven to 160°C. To a large bowl, add the oats, puffed quinoa, almonds, coconut, pumpkin seeds, brown sugar, and cinnamon, and give it a stir.
To a separate medium bowl, add the oil, syrup, almond butter, vanilla, and salt. Whisk until it's all combined into a smooth caramel-like sauce.
Pour this wet mix over the dry mix, and stir until coated.
Transfer to a large lined baking tray and spread it out. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 30 minutes, or until lightly golden, stopping stir once halfway.
Remove from the oven and allow it to cool. It continues to harden as it cools. Add the hemp seeds and dried mango, and toss.
When completely cooled, transfer the granola to a storage container. Enjoy with fruit, and yogurt or milk.

foodapp.title: Spicy Miso Sesame Ramen
foodapp.ingredients:
1½Tbsp sesame paste,
1Tbsp miso paste,
2tsp chili bean paste,
¼cup milk,
1 shallot, 
2 cloves garlic, 
½tsp ginger,
50g shiitake mushrooms,
1Tbsp vegetable oil,
2cups vegetable stock,
4 heads bok choy, 
150g tofu,
1tsp sesame oil,
360g udon noodles,
½ carrot, 
½cup bean sprouts
foodapp.preparation:
In a small bowl, mix the Asian sesame paste, miso paste, bean paste, and almond milk.
Fry the shallot, garlic, ginger, and shiitake in oil in sauté pan on medium-high for 5-7 minutes.
Add the stock and miso mixture to the pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook uncovered for 5-7 minutes.
In the last 30 seconds add bok choy, tofu, and sesame oil.
Cook the noodles separately for 30 seconds, or according to the package instruction. Drain and add to the bowls.
Pour the soup over the noodles and garnish with desired toppings. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Coconut Whip
foodapp.ingredients:
1⅓cups coconut cream,
2Tbsp powdered sugar,
1tsp vanilla extract
foodapp.preparation:
Place the coconut milk can upside-down in the refrigerator for at least 5 hours, but best if left in the fridge overnight to allow the liquid to separate from the fat. Refrigerate a large bowl together with the whisks of your electric hand mixer for at least 10 minutes to cool.
Gently turn the can back right-side-up, and open the can. Pour out the liquid layer on the top, and save this for a future smoothie or curry. Using a spoon, scoop out the solid white coconut fat into a large bowl.
Whip the coconut cream for 3-4 minutes.
Then add in the icing sugar and vanilla, and whip again for an additional minute.
Use the coconut whip to top brownies, fruit crumbles, watermelon pizza, or as a topping on your favorite hot chocolate.
